text: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, in keeping with the promise of life that is in Christ Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text:
To Timothy, my dear son:
Grace, mercy and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I thank God, whom I serve, as my ancestors did, with a clear conscience, as night and day I constantly remember you in my prayers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Recalling your tears, I long to see you, so that I may be filled with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am reminded of your sincere faith, which first lived in your grandmother Lois and in your mother Eunice and, I am persuaded, now lives in you also.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason I remind you to fan into flame the gift of God, which is in you through the laying on of my hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Spirit God gave us does not make us timid, but gives us power, love and self-discipline.
speaker: Narrator

text: So do not be ashamed of the testimony about our Lord or of me his prisoner. Rather, join with me in suffering for the gospel, by the power of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has saved us and called us to a holy life – not because of anything we have done but because of his own purpose and grace. This grace was given us in Christ Jesus before the beginning of time,
speaker: Narrator

text: but it has now been revealed through the appearing of our Saviour, Christ Jesus, who has destroyed death and has brought life and immortality to light through the gospel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of this gospel I was appointed a herald and an apostle and a teacher.
speaker: Narrator

text: That is why I am suffering as I am. Yet this is no cause for shame, because I know whom I have believed, and am convinced that he is able to guard what I have entrusted to him until that day.
speaker: Narrator

text: What you heard from me, keep as the pattern of sound teaching, with faith and love in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Guard the good deposit that was entrusted to you – guard it with the help of the Holy Spirit who lives in us.
speaker: Narrator

text: You know that everyone in the province of Asia has deserted me, including Phygelus and Hermogenes.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the Lord show mercy to the household of Onesiphorus, because he often refreshed me and was not ashamed of my chains.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the contrary, when he was in Rome, he searched hard for me until he found me.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the Lord grant that he will find mercy from the Lord on that day! You know very well in how many ways he helped me in Ephesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: You then, my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the things you have heard me say in the presence of many witnesses entrust to reliable people who will also be qualified to teach others.
speaker: Narrator

text: Join with me in suffering, like a good soldier of Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one serving as a soldier gets entangled in civilian affairs, but rather tries to please his commanding officer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Similarly, anyone who competes as an athlete does not receive the victor’s crown except by competing according to the rules.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hardworking farmer should be the first to receive a share of the crops.
speaker: Narrator

text: Reflect on what I am saying, for the Lord will give you insight into all this.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember Jesus Christ, raised from the dead, descended from David. This is my gospel,
speaker: Narrator

text: for which I am suffering even to the point of being chained like a criminal. But God’s word is not chained.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I endure everything for the sake of the elect, that they too may obtain the salvation that is in Christ Jesus, with eternal glory.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text: Keep reminding God’s people of these things. Warn them before God against quarrelling about words; it is of no value, and only ruins those who listen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do your best to present yourself to God as one approved, a worker who does not need to be ashamed and who correctly handles the word of truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Avoid godless chatter, because those who indulge in it will become more and more ungodly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their teaching will spread like gangrene. Among them are Hymenaeus and Philetus,
speaker: Narrator

text: who have departed from the truth. They say that the resurrection has already taken place, and they destroy the faith of some.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, God’s solid foundation stands firm, sealed with this inscription: ‘The Lord knows those who are his,’ and, ‘Everyone who confesses the name of the Lord must turn away from wickedness.’
speaker: Narrator

text: In a large house there are articles not only of gold and silver, but also of wood and clay; some are for special purposes and some for common use.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who cleanse themselves from the latter will be instruments for special purposes, made holy, useful to the Master and prepared to do any good work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Flee the evil desires of youth and pursue righteousness, faith, love and peace, along with those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t have anything to do with foolish and stupid arguments, because you know they produce quarrels.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord’s servant must not be quarrelsome but must be kind to everyone, able to teach, not resentful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Opponents must be gently instructed, in the hope that God will grant them repentance leading them to a knowledge of the truth,
speaker: Narrator

text: and that they will come to their senses and escape from the trap of the devil, who has taken them captive to do his will.
speaker: Narrator

text: But mark this: there will be terrible times in the last days.
speaker: Narrator

text: People will be lovers of themselves, lovers of money, boastful, proud, abusive, disobedient to their parents, ungrateful, unholy,
speaker: Narrator

text: without love, unforgiving, slanderous, without self-control, brutal, not lovers of the good,
speaker: Narrator

text: treacherous, rash, conceited, lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God –
speaker: Narrator

text: having a form of godliness but denying its power. Have nothing to do with such people.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are the kind who worm their way into homes and gain control over gullible women, who are loaded down with sins and are swayed by all kinds of evil desires,
speaker: Narrator

text: always learning but never able to come to a knowledge of the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, so also these teachers oppose the truth. They are men of depraved minds, who, as far as the faith is concerned, are rejected.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they will not get very far because, as in the case of those men, their folly will be clear to everyone.
speaker: Narrator

text: You, however, know all about my teaching, my way of life, my purpose, faith, patience, love, endurance,
speaker: Narrator

text: persecutions, sufferings – what kinds of things happened to me in Antioch, Iconium and Lystra, the persecutions I endured. Yet the Lord rescued me from all of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: In fact, everyone who wants to live a godly life in Christ Jesus will be persecuted,
speaker: Narrator

text: while evildoers and impostors will go from bad to worse, deceiving and being deceived.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for you, continue in what you have learned and have become convinced of, because you know those from whom you learned it,
speaker: Narrator

text: and how from infancy you have known the Holy Scriptures, which are able to make you wise for salvation through faith in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: All Scripture is God-breathed and is useful for teaching, rebuking, correcting and training in righteousness,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that the servant of God may be thoroughly equipped for every good work.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the presence of God and of Christ Jesus, who will judge the living and the dead, and in view of his appearing and his kingdom, I give you this charge:
speaker: Narrator

text: preach the word; be prepared in season and out of season; correct, rebuke and encourage – with great patience and careful instruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the time will come when people will not put up with sound doctrine. Instead, to suit their own desires, they will gather round them a great number of teachers to say what their itching ears want to hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will turn their ears away from the truth and turn aside to myths.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you, keep your head in all situations, endure hardship, do the work of an evangelist, discharge all the duties of your ministry.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am already being poured out like a drink offering, and the time for my departure is near.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have fought the good fight, I have finished the race, I have kept the faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there is in store for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will award to me on that day – and not only to me, but also to all who have longed for his appearing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do your best to come to me quickly,
speaker: Narrator

text: for Demas, because he loved this world, has deserted me and has gone to Thessalonica. Crescens has gone to Galatia, and Titus to Dalmatia.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only Luke is with me. Get Mark and bring him with you, because he is helpful to me in my ministry.
speaker: Narrator

text: I sent Tychicus to Ephesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you come, bring the cloak that I left with Carpus at Troas, and my scrolls, especially the parchments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Alexander the metalworker did me a great deal of harm. The Lord will repay him for what he has done.
speaker: Narrator

text: You too should be on your guard against him, because he strongly opposed our message.
speaker: Narrator

text: At my first defence, no one came to my support, but everyone deserted me. May it not be held against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord stood at my side and gave me strength, so that through me the message might be fully proclaimed and all the Gentiles might hear it. And I was delivered from the lion’s mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will rescue me from every evil attack and will bring me safely to his heavenly kingdom. To him be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Greet Priscilla and Aquila and the household of Onesiphorus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Erastus stayed in Corinth, and I left Trophimus ill in Miletus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do your best to get here before winter. Eubulus greets you, and so do Pudens, Linus, Claudia and all the brothers and sisters.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord be with your spirit. Grace be with you all.
speaker: Narrator
